welcome.subtitle: Your powerful laboratory to test and launch financial indices.

universesTable.title: Select an S&P DJI universe
universesTable.subtitle: Choose a universe as the starting point for your new index. You can compare several indices to find the best fit.

rebalanceSchedule.title: Set a Rebalance Schedule
rebalanceSchedule.subtitle: Define when and how often your index should rebalance.

scheduleOption.title: Select a schedule option
scheduleOption.tooltip: This option will soon be available. Please contact support for more information

options.label: Use Universe Schedule
options.value: Identical rebalance schedule to your selected universe

options.label: Create Custom Schedule
options.value: Define your own flexible  rebalance schedule

options.label: Upload Schedule
options.value: Manually upload your schedule dates in CSV format

schedulePreview.title: Schedule Preview
schedulePreview.helpText: Set a schedule to preview rebalance dates
schedulePreview.helpUploadText: Upload a CSV file to preview rebalance dates

universeScheduleSetup.title: Schedule setup
universeScheduleSetup.text: Choose a start date for your index rebalance schedule.

scheduleSetup.title: Schedule setup
scheduleSetup.text: Choose a start date for your index rebalance schedule and select from common presets to set your reconstitution and reweighting frequency. This allows you to benchmark your index performance effectively.

dataReferenceDate.title: Data reference date
dataReferenceDate.text: By default, this is the last business day of month prior to rebalance date.
dataReferenceDate.tooltip: This is the specific date on which the data (like prices, dividends, and earnings) is captured to calculate the index's value.

universeReferenceDate.title: Universe reference date
universeReferenceDate.text: By default, this is the last business day of month prior to rebalance date.
universeReferenceDate.tooltip: This refers to the date used to determine which stocks or assets are included in the index based on their eligibility criteria, such as market capitalization or liquidity.

universeScheduleHeader.title: Universe rebalance schedule
universeScheduleHeader.text: Follows the schedule of the selected universe. Regularly updates the index by adding qualifying assets, removing those that no longer meet criteria, and adjusting their weights to reflect current market conditions.

rebalanceScheduleHeader.title: Rebalance schedule
rebalanceScheduleHeader.text: Regularly updates the index by adding qualifying assets, removing those that no longer meet criteria, and adjusting their weights to reflect current market conditions.

reweightingHeader.title: Custom Reweighting Schedule (Optional)
reweightingHeader.text: Modifies the proportional weight of each component within the index. It aims to maintain balance and prevent any single asset from skewing the index's overall performance. By default, reweighting follows the reconstitution schedule.

uploadDatesHeader.title: Upload Schedule
uploadDatesHeader.text: Regularly updates the index by adding qualifying assets, removing those that no longer meet criteria, and adjusting their weights to reflect current market conditions.

uploadDates.title: How it works
howItWorks: Fill out the template file with your custom dates
Re-upload the CSV file to validate and set your dates

nameInput.hint: You can change this name later

assetClassInput.label: Asset Class
assetClassInput.hint: We currently exclusively support Equity indices

previousConfiguration.title: Apply Previous Configuration
previousConfiguration.description: Use the universe and rebalance schedule from a previously created index

name.tooShort: Name should be at least 1 character in length
name.tooLong: Name should be under 2000 characters in length

description.tooShort: Description should be at least 10 characters in length and should contain at least 1 non whitespace
description.tooLong: Description should be under 4000 characters in length

notFound.title: 404 Page not found
notFound.subtitle: Please click the link below to goto the dashboard home

header.title: Methodology Settings
header.subtitle: Set the framework that will sculpt your financial index.

corporateActionTreatment.title: Select Corporate Action Treatment
corporateActionTreatment.body: Select how stocks influence the index's performance. Opt for float market cap to prioritize larger companies, equal weight for balance, or custom stock weight for tailored preferences. Your choice shapes the index's composition and aligns with your investment strategy.
corporateActionTreatment.header: You can change your weighting type when creating your rebalance rules

weightingTypeDescriptions.description: Indices where constituent weights are determined by their float-adjusted market capitalization
Assigns the same weight to every stock during rebalancing, ensuring equal investment amounts in each instrument for a portfolio tracking the index.
Indices in which constituents’ weights are defined by a factor other than market capitalization. Between index rebalancings, corporate actions generally have no effect on index weights.

currency.title: Select Currency
currency.body: Select currencies for the index components. USD is the default. Choose additional currencies to include. Define decrement type to apply a fee reduction: single selection for reduction.
currency.header: You can change your weighting type when creating your rebalance rules

returnType.title: Select Return Type
returnType.body: Your index naturally has a price return and total return, reflecting only price changes and dividends.
returnType.toggleLabel: I want to set net total return
returnType.tableBody: The countries displayed are related to the currencies of have selected for your index. You can find this in the Currency tab.

feeReduction.title: Apply a Fee Reduction/Decrement
feeReduction.body: Optionally apply a fee reduction to the selected currencies. Choose between two methods: index point or standard fee. Index point applies the fee based on index performance, while standard fee applies a fixed fee regardless of performance.
feeReduction.toggleLabel: I want to set a fee reduction
feeReduction.subTitle: Select Combination to Apply Fee Reduction/Decrement To

header.title: Order Index
header.subtitle: Review your index and productionize it for launch.

stepOne.body: Review the selections you have made for your custom index. Ensure that the chosen components align with your investment objectives.

rows.label: Description
rows.value: Snapshot of the top 300 technology companies, showcasing those with the significant growth

rows.label: Frequency
rows.value: Rebalances and reweights effective at the open of the Monday following the third Friday of March, June, September and December.

rows.label: Conditions and Logic
rows.tooltip: Conditions and Logic, Select by Rank

stepTwo.body: Finalize your index by selecting the distribution method for receiveing the index data once the order is fulfilled and has been launched.

stepThree.body: Confirm your index to initiate the production phase. This process takes approximately 3-5 days, after which you will receive an email notification once your custom index is ready for review

nextSteps.header: What happens after I place an order?

steps.body: A member of our team will reach out to execute the appropriate license.

header.title: Upload Portfolio
header.subtitle: Upload your own basket of stocks to create a personalised, client-owned index

howItWorks.title: How it works
steps: Fill out the template file to reflect your portfolio

csvUploadGuidelines.title: CSV Upload Guidelines
csvUploadGuidelines.description:
• Multiple CSV uploads are supported; each file must be under 20MB.
  • Your portfolio's constituents should be within the S&P DJI's scope. Check with S&P DJI Index Finder
  • Date format requirement: YYYYMMDD.
  • Weight values must be numeric.
  • Each effective date requires a unique rebalance date and duplicate stocks on the same date are not permitted.
  • At least one stock must be defined per rebalance date.
  • Security identifiers (CUSIP/ISIN/SEDOL) are not accepted.

reweightingRulesHeader.description: Define constituent weights based on reweighting schedule

dropdown.label: Float Market Cap
dropdown.description: Constituent weights are determined by their float-adjusted market capitalization.

dropdown.label: Equal Weighted
dropdown.description: Assigns the same weight to every stock during rebalancing.

dropdown.label: Custom Stock Weighted
dropdown.description: Weighted by an attribute before applying custom rules.

reweightingRulesHeader.modalIntro: Changing the weighting type of your index will remove any Reweighting rules that you have previously added.

filter.title: Filter
filter.description: Include or exclude stocks based on specific criteria.

select_by_rank.title: Select By Rank
select_by_rank.description: Set first, second and third-choice criteria for filtering stocks.

group_constituents.title: Group Constituents
group_constituents.description: Group stocks based on a specific attribute and independantly apply further functions to the grouping

conditional_logic.title: If/Else condition
conditional_logic.description: Create conditional if/else logic to determine rule execution paths.

ranked_attribute.title: Ranked Attribute
ranked_attribute.description: Assign numerical rankings to stocks based on their order, either ascending or descending

calculated_attribute.title: Calculated Attribute
calculated_attribute.description: Calculate aggregate values (min/max/average/sum, etc.) based on specified attributes and constants.

iterative_cap_floor.title: Cap / Floor stocks
iterative_cap_floor.description: Cap or floor weights for constituents exceeding or falling below a specified threshold

attribute_weight.title: Pro-Rata Weight
attribute_weight.description: Standardise attribute values to a common range or distribution

cumulative_weight_cap.title: Cumulative Weight Cap
cumulative_weight_cap.description: Cap the groups of stocks with a cumulative weighting.

options.name: Filter
options.description: Include or exclude stocks based on specific criteria.
options.tooltip: Define conditions that must be met or avoided to tailor your index composition. This rule enables you to precisely control which stocks are part of your index.

options.name: Select By Rank
options.description: Set first, second and third-choice criteria for filtering stocks.
options.tooltip: Select the top constituents based on a specific attribute. Optionally, you can add a buffer to include additional constituents beyond the specified rank.

options.name: Group Constituents
options.description: Group stocks based on a specific attribute and independantly apply further functions to the grouping
options.tooltip: Group stocks based on a selected attribute and independently apply further rules to each group. For example, group stocks by sector and then apply ranking or calculation functions to each sector separately.

options.name: If/Else condition
options.description: Create conditional if/else logic to determine rule execution paths.
options.tooltip: Use if/else condition to apply different rules based on dynamic conditions. For example, 'For all stocks with a P/E ratio greater than 20, apply a ranking function; for the remaining, assign a default weight.'

options.name: Ranked Attribute
options.description: Assign numerical rankings to stocks based on their order, either ascending or descending
options.tooltip: Rank by 'selected attribute' in ascending or descending order. Use multiple attributes to create a prioritised ranking list

options.name: Calculated Attribute
options.description: Calculate aggregate values (min/max/average/sum, etc.) based on specified attributes and constants.
options.tooltip: Calculate specific mathematical values for selected attribute/s and constants across the eligible universe of stocks. For example find the average market cap of all eligible stocks, or the maximum P/E, P/S, P/B ratios for each stock. Attributes created with this rule can be used as input in other rules.

options.name: Pro-Rata Weight
options.description: Standardise attribute values to a common range or distribution
options.tooltip: Calculate the proportional weight for each stock based on the specified numerical attribute.

options.name: Cap / Floor stocks
options.description: Cap or floor weights for constituents exceeding or falling below a specified threshold
options.tooltip: Set upper or lower limits on the weightings of either all stocks or a selected group of stocks based on a specific attribute by defining a threshold above/below that you wish to cap/floor weights at.

options.name: Cumulative Weight Cap
options.description: Cap the groups of stocks with a cumulative weighting.
options.tooltip: Cap the combined weightings of the top X groups that exceed a specified threshold value. Choose the attribute by which to group the stocks for cumulative weighting calculation.

options.name: Apply UCITS Cap
options.tooltip: Ensure that all constituents exceeding this threshold adhere to the specified UCITS threshold. This ensures compliance with UCITS regulations.

options.name: Group Constituents
options.description: Group stocks based on a specific attribute and independantly apply further functions to the grouping
options.tooltip: Group stocks based on a selected attribute and independently apply further rules to each group. For example, group stocks by sector and then apply ranking or calculation functions to each sector separately.

options.name: If/Else condition
options.description: Create conditional if/else logic to determine rule execution paths.
options.tooltip: Use if/else condition to apply different rules based on dynamic conditions. For example, 'For all stocks with a P/E ratio greater than 20, apply a ranking function; for the remaining, assign a default weight.'

options.name: Ranked Attribute
options.description: Assign numerical rankings to stocks based on their order, either ascending or descending
options.tooltip: Rank by 'selected attribute' in ascending or descending order. Use multiple attributes to create a prioritised ranking list

options.name: Calculated Attribute
options.description: Calculate aggregate values (min/max/average/sum, etc.) based on specified attributes and constants.
options.tooltip: Calculate specific mathematical values for selected attribute/s and constants across the eligible universe of stocks. For example find the average market cap of all eligible stocks, or the maximum P/E, P/S, P/B ratios for each stock. Attributes created with this rule can be used as input in other rules.

options.name: Pro-Rata Weight
options.description: Standardise attribute values to a common range or distribution
options.tooltip: Calculate the proportional weight for each stock based on the specified numerical attribute.

rebalanceEditor.compositionFooterTooltip: Complete rule configuration to update the preview
rebalanceEditor.generateBody: View a simulated snapshot of your index constituents
